modules.description: Encodes and decodes binary data using Base64 transformation, converting between byte arrays and ASCII strings. Processes input as sequences of 8-bit bytes and outputs 4-character groups representing 6-bit values. Useful for safely transmitting binary content over text-based protocols or storing it in formats that restrict non-ASCII characters.

Provides functions to decode Base64 data using a manual input source, tracking byte counts and handling malformed sequences, padding errors, and dangerous input. Works with byte buffers, decoders, and custom input/output sources to process encoded data streams. Supports incremental decoding and encoding, allowing control over buffer management and error recovery.

Encodes and decodes binary data into and from Base64 strings using customizable alphabets, including standard and URI-safe variants. Processes raw byte sequences and returns either decoded byte strings or encoded Base64 strings with optional padding control. Supports error handling through result types and efficient sub-string operations to minimize memory allocation.
